Package WordCounterServer

Class Connect

java.lang.Object
WordCounterServer.Connect
public class Connect
extends java.lang.Object
This is a fairly basic class that is used for storing and accessing the parameters that are associated with word objects.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Connect()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static void createTable()
    This is a method that is used to create a word table if a table does not exist.
    static void deleteAll()
    Method that is used to delete all the contents of the word table.
    static void deleteArtifacts()
    When I run the program as a .jar, during the database writing portion, it seems that there are textual artifacts that are being generated.

    This method is used to drop the table from the db.

    Simple method for establishing a connection to the database.

  • Method Details

    • getConnection

      public static java.sql.Connection getConnection() throws java.lang.Exception
      Simple method for establishing a connection to the database. These are the database parameters on my personal computer.
      Returns:
      This method returns the Connection object.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - I doubt it can throw an exception, but the tutorial told me to keep this here.

    • createTable

      public static void createTable() throws java.lang.Exception
      This is a method that is used to create a word table if a table does not exist.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - I doubt it can throw an exception, but the tutorial told me to keep this here.

    • insertWord

      public static void insertWord​(java.lang.String wordName, int wordCount) throws java.lang.Exception
      Method that is used to insert a single word into the database table. This class is too slow for normal usage.
      Parameters:
      wordName - This is the name of the word object.
      wordCount - This is the count of the word object.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - I doubt it can throw an exception, but the tutorial told me to keep this here.

    • deleteAll

      public static void deleteAll() throws java.lang.Exception
      Method that is used to delete all the contents of the word table.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - I doubt it can throw an exception, but the tutorial told me to keep this here.

    • getList

      public static java.util.ArrayList<Word> getList() throws java.lang.Exception
      Method that is used to sort and store the contents of the database table.
      Returns:
      It returns the WordList array that contains WordCounterServer.Word objects.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - I doubt it can throw an exception, but the tutorial told me to keep this here.

    • writeArrayList

      public static void writeArrayList​(java.util.ArrayList<Word> arrayList) throws java.lang.Exception
      This method is used to insert the contents of an array list into the database. Edit: I changed this to use a batch. If I used individual inserts it would take over 20 seconds to run this, but with the batch it's reduced time is around 7 seconds.
      Parameters:
      arrayList - Requires an ArrayList of words.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - I doubt it can throw an exception, but the tutorial told me to keep this here.

    • deleteArtifacts

      public static void deleteArtifacts() throws java.lang.Exception
      When I run the program as a .jar, during the database writing portion, it seems that there are textual artifacts that are being generated. This method deletes those objects.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - This method will throw an exception, especially if something goes wrong during the db connection and updating processes.

    • dropTable

      public static void dropTable() throws java.lang.Exception
      This method is used to drop the table from the db.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - This method will throw an exception, especially if something goes wrong during the db connection and updating processes.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      This is an overridden toString method that is useful for testing purposes.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      Returns a string of the object name.
